boat.full_description:
Her name at the time of launching is not known. She was built as a smack and was refitted and converted from sail to motor in 1935. She came into the possession of Mr. Charles Chase of Kings Lynn in 1912, and was re-named Charles Josephine.

In 1945 she was re-named Mermaid, by Worfolk Bros., Kings Lynn, who refitted and sold her to T. Lineham of Sutton Bridge. She fished the Wash until 1980.

Bought by Jack Waterhouse & his son of Woodrolfe Boatyard, Tollesbury, Essex, they rebuilt her back to her early state of sail, (Tan main, white headsails and topsail). They started to rebuild her in October 1981 renewing frames & floors. 70% of the planking, covering boards, stanchions etc. also mast spars and rigging. The sails are by Tailors of Maldon. The next owners had known her for thirty years and always admired her. They farmed by the river Nene at Sutton Bridge where she was berthed and saw her most days, passing by to fish in the Wash.
boat.name: Mermaid
